sub_title: Student | HBO | Agribusiness and Business Administration
summary:
Meet Swapnil Baste, an aspiring agripreneur and dedicated agribusiness student with a burning passion for sustainable food production. Born in India and raised in a farming household, I always had a deep-rooted connection to the land, and a profound respect for the agricultural profession developed witnessing the hardships of farmers in my country. 
Driven by the desire to make a positive impact on the farmer's condition in India, I embarked on a journey to study agribusiness in the Netherlands, recognising the pivotal role it plays in transforming the way food is produced and consumed. With an unwavering commitment to sustainability, I want to create a future where farmers can thrive and where consumers can enjoy nutritious, ethically sourced food. My quest for knowledge extends beyond the confines of the classroom. 
I actively seek opportunities to engage with farmers, industry experts, and policymakers to gain practical insights into the challenges and opportunities within the agricultural sector.

school.name: Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences

education.field_of_study: Business, Management, Marketing, and Related Support Services

school.name: College of Agriculture and Allied Sciences Baramati

awards.title: Arnhem Student City Challenge
awards.description:
Arnhem Studiestad organizes hackathon: the Student City Challenge Arnhem. During the event, which takes place on October 13 and 14, I and other students tackled challenges that affect our daily life:

1. Diversity and Inclusion
2. Hybrid Society
3. Living
4. Climate change

We worked for 2 days in a great location with a team of dedicated professionals and a program that inspired us to come up with solutions never thought possible. 

I and my team worked on the topic of Climate change and we proposed the idea of Student Impact.
Student Impact is a startup that is taking on the challenge of low pickup of sustainable products among young consumers. The primary hurdle in achieving this goal has been the high cost of such products. 
To address this issue, Student Impact plans to subsidize these products through government and private funding sources and sell them at a comparable rate. The company aims to achieve this by setting up stores that offer easy-to-understand labeling of products and their environmental impact ratings. 
In addition, the supply chain will be fully transparent, allowing customers to make informed decisions. The stores will have screens where customers can access the value chain of the products and their impact on the environment to make sustainable purchases.   
With this innovative approach, Student Impact is determined to make sustainable products accessible to all and empower young consumers to make responsible choices.

awards.title: People's Choice award
awards.description:
Greentrepreneur 2022 was held on Friday, June 17th and bachelor students of the study programs Animal Husbandry, Food Technology, International Business in Food and Flowers, International Development Management as well as Management of the Living Environment presented their innovative ideas.

The students were presented with different awards, such as the Feasibility Awards, Innovation Awards, the VHL Sustainable Transitions awards, Social Media awards, and People’s Choice awards.

The idea was about Eco Nutrition, a startup trying to solve the problem of organic solid waste management in the urban city of Mumbai. We proposed a business plan for diverting the segregated organic waste from food businesses, which would otherwise end up in landfills, to process it using the black soldier fly insect. 
The insect larvae feed on the rejected food and make it into a healthy, protein-rich, high-quality animal diet. At the same time, a by-product of this process is that the food gets converted into plant nutrition and soil additives. This would reduce the burden on landfills and put the food waste back into the food chain, making it circular. 
Our idea received a lot of votes from the audience and we won the People's Choice award.
awards.issuer: Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences

awards.title: Sustainable Trainsition Awards
awards.description: The innovative business plan for Eco Nutrition impressed the judges and would be a possible solution in the field of sustainable waste management. By diverting segregated organic waste from food businesses to the black soldier fly insect for processing, the startup found a way to turn rejected food into a high-quality animal diet while producing plant nutrition and soil additives as a by-product. This circular approach not only reduces the burden on landfills but also puts the waste back into the food chain, making it an eco-friendly solution. Eco Nutrition, would make a significant contribution to the sustainability of the urban city of Mumbai.
awards.issuer: Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences

awards.title: Holland Scholarship award
awards.description: The Holland Scholarship is meant for international students from outside the European Economic Area (EEA) who want to do their bachelor’s or master's in the Netherlands. This scholarship is financed by the Dutch Ministry of Education, Culture, and Science as well as several Dutch research universities and universities of applied sciences. The scholarship amounts to € 5,000.
awards.issuer: Dutch Ministry of Education together with Dutch research universities of applied sciences

profile_positions.description: The thesis explores the potential of BSF products in the Thai aqua and pet feed market. The research seeks to create a comprehensive strategy for entering the Thailand market through market research, regulatory framework analysis, and interviews with potential clients.
profile_positions.title: Bachelor Thesis
